definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to confine/to lock up/to pen in
circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle

sentences.english: I'm a little scared. Do you offer the lifebuoy for us?
sentences.chinese: 我有点怕了，你们救生圈吗？

sentences.english: Please repaint all the life buoys of our ship.
sentences.chinese: 请把我轮所有的救生圈重新油漆。
干电池式救生圈自亮浮灯。

sentences.english: I'm a little scared. Do you offer the lifebuoy for us?
sentences.chinese: 我有点怕了，你们提供救生圈吗？

sentences.english: It's too deep out there and we didn't bring your floaties.
sentences.chinese: 那里太深了，而且我们没将你们的救生圈带来。

sentences.english: Humorous is lives in the mighty waves life-saving jacket.
sentences.chinese: 幽默是生活波涛中的救生圈。

sentences.english: Of course, many conservatives want to get rid of life preservers altogether.
sentences.chinese: 当然，许多保守连想连救生圈一起摆脱掉。

sentences.english: Produces orange smoke for daylight use and combined with the lifebuoy.
sentences.chinese: 产生橙色烟雾，供白昼使用，并连附于救生圈上。

sentences.english: The U.S. economy is buoyed by foreign investment into its treasury securities.
sentences.chinese: 外国投资美国财政债券，变成美国经济的救生圈。

sentences.english: We tried to throw a life buoy. She could not grab it.
sentences.chinese: 我们试着扔救生圈给她，但是她抓不住。

sentences.english: A group of youngsters tied a bike tyre around the body as a swimming aid.
sentences.chinese: 一群年轻人将自行车胎绑在身上作为救生圈。

definition: swim ring/swim tube/(fig.) (coll.) spare tire (roll of fat around the waist)
to fall into water/to sink/overboard/fig. to degenerate/to sink (into depravity)/to go to the dogs
